did.unittitle:
Norman G. Owen collection
1979-1980
did.abstract: Transcripts and cassette tapes of oral interviews conducted by students in class on the Vietnam War.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Norman G. Owen (donor no. 5376).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Norman G. Owen collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Norman G. Owen was a professor of history at the University of Michigan. In one of his classes, he had students interview participants in the Vietnam War, both military and civilian.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of transcripts and cassette tapes made by students in the class on the Vietnam War taught by University of Michigan professor Norman Owen. The interviewees were members of the military, Vietnamese refugees, draft resisters, and anti-war activists. There is also a smaller series of files relating to Vietnam War veterans affairs.
Three of the interviewees requested that they remain anonymous in any publication made from their words. These interviews require that the researcher sign a statement of confidentiality.

did.unittitle: Interviews: Vietnam War period
Dumont, Murl. Enlisted man, personnel specialist with US defense artillery and 155 Artillery
McLaughlin, S .E. Platoon and company commander, Co. G, 2nd Bat., 9th Marines
Voss, Edward. Chairman of Baptist Campus, C.O. during Korean War, draft counselor.
Minh Lieu. Chinese, born in Vietnam.
Rohrback, Michael. Marine courier for U.S. Embassy and Consulate in Vietnam
Turner, Gerald. Staff sergeant in Airborne Ranger's Seventy-fifth Infantry, Co. N in Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia
Furr, William. Infantry squad leader, 22nd Infantry and helicopter evacuation in 101st Airborne in Vietnam
Dries, James. Army captain in transportation at port of Quinhon, later chairman of committee of Vietnam Era Veterans
Abner, Jack. Helicopter pilot with 101st Airborne Division
Anonymous Saigon medical student

accessrestrict.p: [Restricted access; participant to remain anonymous; researcher must sign statement of confidentiality]

did.unittitle: Pike, G. Glen. War protester.
King, John O. Soldier.
-------Keu. Soldier.
Byerly, George Lee. Soldier.
Carroll, Michael. Soldier.
Hughel, Thomas. Soldier.
Drake, Thomas. Specialist 4th class, U.S. Army in Vietnam
Lapish, Robert, Jr. Soldier.
Cost, Irene. War protester.
Harper, James P. Soldier.
Anonymous Anti-Vietnam War activist.
Walter, Barry. Soldier.

accessrestrict.p: [Restricted: interviewee must be informed of the use made of his interview]

did.unittitle: Wellman, Robert. Infantry officer.
Duquette, Donald N. Vietnam War protester.

accessrestrict.p: [Restrictions on publication of all or parts of his interview]

did.unittitle: Byrne, Daniel P. Army draftee who published anti-war newspaper while serving in Germany.
Warner, James H. Marine pilot, prisoner-of-war in North Vietnam.
Anonymous Airborne enlisted man.
Barber, Edward, Jr. Airport mail handler in Bangkok.

accessrestrict.p: [Restricted access; participant to remain anonymous; researcher must sign statement of confidentiality]

did.unittitle: Behte, Paul. Coordinator of our attacks from Quam Tri and elsewhere.

accessrestrict.p: [Restricted access; participant to remain anonymous; researcher must sign statement of confidentiality]

did.unittitle: Brakke, Jim. Navy enlisted man stationed on base at Nha Trang.
Case, John. Airborne (82nd) Ranger operating out of Da Nang.
Casey, James. Member of Special Forces reconnaissance team in Delta.
Dagneau, John, II. Air Force Para-Rescue Medic stationed at Bien Hoa.
Hannah, Wade. Marine rifleman in northern South Vietnam.
Schurig, Michael. Army enlistee with intelligence gathering unit operating from Tan Son Nhut.
Warner, James H. Marine pilot; P.O.W., 1967-1971.
Whitten, David. Member of Special Forces who trained and ran Cambodian mercenaries in Delta.
